p: MERS or Camel Flu caused by the MERS-CoV, was first identified in 2012 in Saudi Arabia and caused outbreaks in South Korea and Saudi Arabia. Symptoms varied from none or mild common cold such as fever, myalgia, and cough to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), sepsis, multi-organ failure, and even death. [ 30] About 2500 confirmed cases were detected worldwide, and the fatality rate was reported as 34.3%. [ 31].
